alert.note: Alert for Bayfield (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 1:48PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wisconsin, including the following area, Bayfield County. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 143 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. There are several road closures in the warned area. - Numerous city or township roads remained closed due to flooding including in Town of Lincoln, Oulu, Mason, and township of Keystone. All state and county highways have been reopened. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ashland, Iron River, Drummond, Benoit, Ino, Town of Delta, Mason, Grand View and Moquah. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
